question: Why was [Event] organized?
sparql:
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX oa: <http://www.w3.org/ns/oa#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
SELECT ?eventName ?eventDescription
WHERE {
    BIND (ex:LiveAid1985 AS ?event)
    ?annotation a oa:Annotation ;
           dct:subject ex:Background ;
           oa:hasTarget ?event ;
           oa:hasBody ?background .
    ?background schema:description ?eventDescription .
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
}
LIMIT 5

bindings.eventDescription: Live Aid was a dual-venue global benefit concert held on 13 July 1985, inspired by the Band Aid charity single “Do They Know It’s Christmas?” to raise funds for famine relief in Ethiopia. Conceived by Bob Geldof and Midge Ure, it was broadcast to nearly 2 billion viewers worldwide and became a landmark in humanitarian fundraising and popular culture.

question: What kind of event was [Event]
sparql:
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX oa: <http://www.w3.org/ns/oa#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
SELECT ?eventName ?eventDescription
WHERE {
    BIND (ex:LiveAid1985 AS ?event)
    ?annotation a oa:Annotation ;
           dct:subject ex:Background ;
           oa:hasTarget ?event ;
           oa:hasBody ?background .
    ?background schema:description ?eventDescription .
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
}
LIMIT 5

bindings.eventDescription: Live Aid was a dual-venue global benefit concert held on 13 July 1985, inspired by the Band Aid charity single “Do They Know It’s Christmas?” to raise funds for famine relief in Ethiopia. Conceived by Bob Geldof and Midge Ure, it was broadcast to nearly 2 billion viewers worldwide and became a landmark in humanitarian fundraising and popular culture.

question: How many satellites were used during [Event]’s broadcast?
sparql:
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
SELECT ?eventName ?satelliteNetworkDescription (SUM(?count) AS ?totalSatellites)
WHERE {
    BIND(  ex:LiveAid1985 AS ?event)
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
    ?broadcast a schema:BroadcastEvent ;
               schema:superEvent ?event ;
               ex:facilitatedBy ?satelliteNetwork .
    ?satelliteNetwork schema:hasPart ?fleet .
    ?satelliteNetwork schema:description ?satelliteNetworkDescription .
    ?fleet schema:numberOfItems ?count .
}
GROUP BY ?eventName ?broadcast ?satelliteNetworkDescription
LIMIT 5

bindings.satelliteNetworkDescription: A network of commercial telecommunications satellites including five Intelsat satellites, which were integral to the global broadcast of the 1985 Live Aid concert.

question: What was the attendance at each venue of [Event]?
How did [Event] influence future benefit concerts?
Which [Performance] at [Event] is considered iconic?
sparql:
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX mm: <https://w3id.org/polifonia/ontology/music-meta/>
SELECT DISTINCT ?eventName ?iconicPerformanceDescription
WHERE {
    ?performance a mm:LivePerformance ;
                 schema:isPartOf ?event ;
    			 ex:isIconic ?isIconic .
    ?performance schema:description ?iconicPerformanceDescription .
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
    FILTER(?event =   ex:LiveAid1985)
    FILTER(?isIconic = true)
}
LIMIT 5

bindings.iconicPerformanceDescription: Bowie’s ‘Heroes’ and the decision to cut a song to air the famine appeal footage—credited with catalysing donations.
Dire Straits with Sting on ‘Money for Nothing’—a zeitgeist moment of 1985 performed live at Wembley.
Career-defining set in Philadelphia; quips about keeping the jacket on, then delivers a hit-packed performance.
Mick Jagger & Tina Turner tear through ‘State of Shock’ / ‘It’s Only Rock ’n’ Roll’; high-voltage duet etched into Live Aid lore.
The only artist to play both Wembley and Philadelphia the same day (by Concorde); also drums for Clapton and Led Zeppelin.

question: Which [Organization] archived the broadcast of [Event]?
What is the preservation status of [Event] broadcasts at [Venue]?
sparql:
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
SELECT ?eventName ?subBroadcastDescription ?broadcastCompanyName ?preserved
WHERE {
    VALUES ?mainEvent {   ex:LiveAid1985 }
    ?mainEvent ex:hadBroadcast ?mainBroadcast .
    ?mainEvent schema:name ?eventName .
    ?mainBroadcast schema:subEvent ?subBroadcast .
    ?subBroadcast schema:description ?subBroadcastDescription .
    ?subBroadcast schema:provider ?broadcastCompany .
    ?subBroadcast ex:wasBroadcastPreserved ?preserved .
    OPTIONAL { ?broadcastCompany schema:name ?broadcastCompanyName }
    OPTIONAL { ?broadcastCompany rdfs:label ?broadcastCompanyName }
}
ORDER BY DESC(?preserved)
LIMIT 5

executed_query:
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX oa: <http://www.w3.org/ns/oa#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
SELECT ?eventName ?eventDescription
WHERE {
    BIND ({event} AS ?event)
    ?annotation a oa:Annotation ;
           dct:subject ex:Background ;
           oa:hasTarget ?event ;
           oa:hasBody ?background .
    ?background schema:description ?eventDescription .
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
}
LIMIT 5

PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX oa: <http://www.w3.org/ns/oa#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
SELECT ?eventName ?eventDescription
WHERE {
    BIND ({event} AS ?event)
    ?annotation a oa:Annotation ;
           dct:subject ex:Background ;
           oa:hasTarget ?event ;
           oa:hasBody ?background .
    ?background schema:description ?eventDescription .
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
}
LIMIT 5

PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
SELECT ?eventName ?satelliteNetworkDescription (SUM(?count) AS ?totalSatellites)
WHERE {
    BIND(  {event} AS ?event)
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
    ?broadcast a schema:BroadcastEvent ;
               schema:superEvent ?event ;
               ex:facilitatedBy ?satelliteNetwork .
    ?satelliteNetwork schema:hasPart ?fleet .
    ?satelliteNetwork schema:description ?satelliteNetworkDescription .
    ?fleet schema:numberOfItems ?count .
}
GROUP BY ?eventName ?broadcast ?satelliteNetworkDescription
LIMIT 5

PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
SELECT ?eventName ?founderName
WHERE {
    BIND(  {event} AS ?event)
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
    ?event schema:organizer ?founder .
    ?founder schema:name ?founderName .
}
LIMIT 5

PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX mm: <https://w3id.org/polifonia/ontology/music-meta/>
SELECT DISTINCT ?eventName (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?artistName; separator=", ") AS ?allPerformingArtists)
WHERE {
    ?performance a schema:Event, mm:LivePerformance ;
           schema:isPartOf ?event ;
           schema:performer ?artist .
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
    ?artist schema:name ?artistName .
    FILTER(?event =   {event})
}
GROUP BY ?eventName
LIMIT 5

PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX mm: <https://w3id.org/polifonia/ontology/music-meta/>
SELECT (GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT ?workName; separator=", ") AS ?allWorkName)
WHERE {
    ?performance a mm:LivePerformance ;
                 schema:isPartOf ?event ;
    			 ex:isIconic ?isIconic .
    ?performance mm:performedWork ?work .
    ?performance schema:performer ?artist .
    ?work schema:name ?workName .
    FILTER(?event =   {event})
    FILTER(?artist = {musicgroup})
}
LIMIT 5

rows.eventDescription: Live Aid was a dual-venue global benefit concert held on 13 July 1985, inspired by the Band Aid charity single “Do They Know It’s Christmas?” to raise funds for famine relief in Ethiopia. Conceived by Bob Geldof and Midge Ure, it was broadcast to nearly 2 billion viewers worldwide and became a landmark in humanitarian fundraising and popular culture.

executed_query:
PREFIX ex: <http://wembrewind.live/ex#>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX skos: <http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#>
PREFIX oa: <http://www.w3.org/ns/oa#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>
SELECT ?eventName ?eventDescription
WHERE {
    BIND (ex:LiveAid1985 AS ?event)
    ?annotation a oa:Annotation ;
           dct:subject ex:Background ;
           oa:hasTarget ?event ;
           oa:hasBody ?background .
    ?background schema:description ?eventDescription .
    ?event schema:name ?eventName .
}
LIMIT 5

}
